metadata.Description: Agricultural practices that sustainably increase productivity, resilience, and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

level 1.Description: Climate-smart agriculture implements sustainable farming practices that reduce greenhouse gas emissions and promote climate resilience.
Climate-smart agriculture funds research and development projects to improve agricultural practices and technologies for climate adaptation.
Climate-smart agriculture focuses on climate change mitigation by implementing practices that reduce carbon emissions and enhance carbon sequestration.
Climate-smart agriculture is implemented in rural communities to improve food security, livelihoods, and resilience to climate impacts.
Climate-smart agriculture partners with local farmers to promote the adoption of sustainable and climate-resilient farming practices.
Climate-smart agriculture contributes to the achievement of sustainable development goals, particularly those related to food security, poverty reduction, and climate action.
Climate-smart agriculture monitors crop yields to assess the effectiveness of sustainable farming practices and identify areas for improvement.
Climate-smart agriculture targets smallholder farmers to provide them with the knowledge, resources, and support needed to adopt climate-resilient farming practices.

subelement_relations.Description: Crop diversification is a key component of climate-smart agriculture, which involves growing a variety of crops in a single area. This practice helps to enhance resilience to climate change by reducing the risk of crop failure and increasing overall productivity.

Agroforestry is an important practice within climate-smart agriculture that involves integrating trees and shrubs with crops and livestock. It provides multiple benefits such as improved soil fertility, increased biodiversity, and enhanced climate resilience.

Conservation agriculture is a key approach within climate-smart agriculture that promotes sustainable and resource-efficient farming practices. It involves minimizing soil disturbance, maintaining soil cover, and practicing crop rotation to improve soil health, water retention, and overall productivity.

Precision agriculture is an advanced farming technique that utilizes technology and data to optimize crop production while minimizing resource inputs. It involves the use of sensors, GPS, drones, and other tools to monitor and manage crops with precision, leading to increased efficiency and reduced environmental impact.

Climate-resilient crops are specific varieties or species of crops that are bred or selected to withstand and adapt to the impacts of climate change. These crops possess traits such as drought tolerance, heat resistance, disease resistance, and improved nutrient efficiency, contributing to the overall resilience of agricultural systems.
